title: Getting Started with Markdown
body: Markdown is a lightweight markup language that you can use to add formatting elements to plaintext text documents. Created by John Gruber in 2004, Markdown is now one of the world's most popular markup languages.
summary: Learn the basics of Markdown syntax and start writing beautiful documents.
author: Jane Smith

title: Advanced CSS Techniques
body:
CSS Grid and Flexbox have revolutionized how we build layouts on the web. In this article, we'll explore some advanced techniques that will take your designs to the next level.

Key topics covered:
- Grid template areas
- Nested flex containers
- CSS custom properties
- Container queries
summary: Deep dive into modern CSS layout techniques including Grid and Flexbox.
author: John Doe

title: Introduction to APIs
body: An API (Application Programming Interface) is a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate with each other. Think of it as a waiter in a restaurant - you tell the waiter what you want, and they bring it back from the kitchen.
summary: A beginner-friendly guide to understanding and working with APIs.
author: Alex Johnson
